title: Water Tumbler, "Muslin glass set", 1891
provenance: This set was ordered for use at gala dinners to replace the glasses of set No. 100 "Leaf cut," which were becoming too expensive. Empress Elisabeth strongly preferred the dainty design of this beautiful set.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Dale and Doug Anderson, Anonymous Donor, Arthur Liu, and Prairie Pictures, Inc. and from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Mouth-blown crystal, hand-painted gold rims and engraved Habsburg crest

participants.person_name: J. & L. Lobmeyr GmbH, Vienna, Austria

exhibitions.title: Ted Muehling Selects: Lobmeyr Glass from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Water Tumbler, "Muslin glass set", 1891.
1891. Glass. Museum purchase through gift of Dale and Doug Anderson, Anonymous Donor, Arthur Liu, and Prairie Pictures, Inc. and from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund. 2009-18-13.
